intro: Sersalisia luzoniensis, commonly known as the Luzon seral, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and broad, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
